oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Menâkıb-ı Mevlânâ : manuscript, [1827]
Menâkıb-ı Mevlânâ Celâleddin
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Legends about Jalāladdīn Rūmī. One lengthy story narrates a conversation the author had with Rūmī in his dream.
According to the colophon (f. 100r), copy completed on 21 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1243 AH [October 11, 1827 AD] in the hand of Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir Qayṣarī.

Written in naskh script, in one column, 17 lines per page, in black, framed within a red line. Persian phrases vocalized and red overlined. Section headings in red. Catchwords. Occasional notes in green ink.
Dark-cream glazed laid paper. Board cover. Envelope flap. Spine torn; volume loosely attached to binding.
With: Şerh-i Cezîretü'l-mesnevî / Ahmed Meknî (ff. 10v.-100r) ; Hall-i ebyât-ı müşkilât-ı Celâleddin Rûmî (ff. 101r-107r) ; Risâle-yi esrâr-ı tarîk (ff. 107v-111v).
MS Turk 53. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
